io.github.rubenchristoffer.hetty

Class HTTPConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.rubenchristoffer.hetty.HTTPConnection

  • public class HTTPConnection
extends Object
    Class that handles underlying TCP / TLS connection to server. You can use this class for sending / receiving individual HTTP messages / packets. It is also possible to access the underlying socket or write raw bytes. This is the first layer in the HTTP API and may be used directly or indirectly through higher-level classes.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer

      • HTTPConnection

        public HTTPConnection()
        Creates a new HTTPConnection object with url=null and addChunkedTransferDecoder=true.

      • HTTPConnection

        public HTTPConnection(boolean addChunkedTransferDecoder)
        Creates a new HTTPConnection object with url=null.
        Parameters:
        addChunkedTransferDecoder - is used for determining if chunked transfer codec should be supported

      • HTTPConnection

        public HTTPConnection(URL url)
        Creates a new HTTPConnection object with addChunkedTransferDecoder=true.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL of the server you wish to connect to

      • HTTPConnection

        public HTTPConnection(String url)
        Creates a new HTTPConnection object with addChunkedTransferDecoder=true.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL of the server you wish to connect to
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if URL is invalid

      • HTTPConnection

        public HTTPConnection(URL url,
                      boolean addChunkedTransferDecoder)
        Creates a new HTTPConnection object.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL of the server you wish to connect to
        addChunkedTransferDecoder - is used for determining if chunked transfer codec should be supported

    • Method Detail

      • addSupportedTransferDecoder

        public void addSupportedTransferDecoder(HTTPTransferDecoder transferCodec)
        Adds a new supported transfer decoder for this connection.
        Parameters:
        transferCodec - is the codec you want this connection to support
        See Also:
        for information on how decoders are chosen when reading packets

      • insertSupportedTransferDecoder

        public void insertSupportedTransferDecoder(HTTPTransferDecoder transferCodec,
                                           int index)
        Inserts a new supported transfer decoder for this connection at a specific index of the list.
        Parameters:
        transferCodec - is the codec you want this connection to support
        index - is the index where you want the decoder to be inserted

      • removeSupportedTransferDecoder

        public void removeSupportedTransferDecoder(int index)
        Removes a supported transfer decoder for this connection
        Parameters:
        index - is the index of the decoder you want to remove

      • getSupportedTransferDecoders

        public List<HTTPTransferDecoder> getSupportedTransferDecoders()
        Gets supported transfer decoders.
        Returns:
        a read-only wrapper list of the supported decoders that is always up-to-date

      • openConnection

        public void openConnection()
        Opens a TCP / SSL socket and connects to the server. It will automatically detect if you're trying to connect using HTTP or HTTPS.
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if something goes wrong opening the connection

      • isConnectionOpen

        public boolean isConnectionOpen()
        Is the connection open?
        Returns:
        true if the connection is open, false if the socket is null or closed

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the TCP / SSL socket.
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if it could not close connection

      • sendPacket

        public void sendPacket(HTTPPacket packet)
        Sends a HTTP packet (either a HTTPRequest or HTTPResponse) to the server. Applying filters is set to true.
        Parameters:
        packet - is the packet you want to send

      • sendPacket

        public void sendPacket(HTTPPacket packet,
                       boolean applyFilters)
        Sends a HTTP packet (either a HTTPRequest or HTTPResponse) to the server.
        Parameters:
        packet - is the packet you want to send
        applyFilters - determines whether filters will be applied before sending packet
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if something went wrong sending HTTP packet

      • sendRawPacket

        public void sendRawPacket(HTTPRawPacket rawHttpPacket)
                   throws HTTPConnectionException
        Sends a raw HTTP packet to the server.
        Parameters:
        rawHttpPacket - is the packet you want to send
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if something goes wrong sending raw packet
        IllegalArgumentException - if rawHttpPacket is null

      • sendRawBytes

        public void sendRawBytes(byte[] bytes)
                  throws HTTPConnectionException
        Sends raw byte array to server.
        Parameters:
        bytes - is the byte array you want to send
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if something goes wrong sending raw byte array

      • readRawPacket

        public HTTPRawPacket readRawPacket()
        Reads the raw HTTP packet from the server. This will first read the entire HTTP header. After reading header, it will start at the bottom of the list of supported decoders and use the first available decoder.
        Returns:
        a raw HTTP packet
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if something goes wrong with the connection
        HTTPUnsupportedContentException - if no decoders support decoding the body

      • readPacket

        public HTTPPacket readPacket()
        Reads the raw HTTP packet from the server and parses it to create a HTTPPacket. You can cast this to either HTTPRequest or HTTPResponse. This method is a combination of readRawPacket() and HTTPParser.parsePacket(HTTPRawPacket)
        Returns:
        HTTPPacket object

      • setURL

        public void setURL(URL url)
            throws HTTPConnectionException
        Sets the current URL used by this connection. Will try to close connection if host of URL is different from current URL host.
        Parameters:
        url - is the URL you want to set
        Throws:
        HTTPConnectionException - if URL host is different and closing connection failed

      • getURL

        public URL getURL()
        Gets the URL.
        Returns:
        the current URL used by this connection.

      • getUnderlyingSocket

        public Socket getUnderlyingSocket()
        Gets the underlying socket.
        Returns:
        the underlying TCP / SSL socket
